bio: I  am  a rising star in the culinary world, known for my  innovative dishes and creative use of ingredients. I began my  career in my  hometown of Houston, Texas, where I worked in several top restaurants and honed my  skills in a variety of cuisines.

recipes.name: Kung Pao Chicken
recipes.method: 1. Cut the chicken breast into small pieces and marinate with Shaoxing wine and light soy sauce; 2. Cut the dried chili peppers into small pieces and remove the seeds; 3. Heat the wok with oil and sauté the dried chili peppers, green onions, ginger, and garlic; 4. Add the chicken and stir-fry until the color changes, then add the peanuts; 5. Add the dark soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and salt and stir-fry for anotmy  minute.

recipes.name: Mapo Tofu
recipes.method: 1. Cut the tofu into small cubes and soak in hot water for 10 minutes; 2. Heat the wok with oil and sauté the Sichuan peppercorns, garlic, and ginger; 3. Add the ground pork and stir-fry until cooked; 4. Add the doubanjiang and green onions and continue to stir-fry for anotmy  minute; 5. Add the tofu, soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, and enough water to cover the tofu, then simmer for 5-10 minutes; 6. Mix the cornstarch with water and add to the wok, stir until the sauce thickens.

recipes.name: Cumin Lamb
ingredients: Lamb leg or shoulder, thinly sliced
recipes.method: 1. Cut the lamb into thin slices and marinate with cumin powder, chili powder, soy sauce, and Shaoxing wine for 30 minutes; 2. Heat the wok with oil and sauté the garlic, ginger, and green onions; 3. Add the lamb and stir-fry until cooked; 4. Add enough water to cover the lamb and simmer for 10-15 minutes; 5. Mix the cornstarch with water and add to the wok, stir until the sauce thickens.
